intro: Phacelia knightii, commonly known as Knight's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in early spring. Phacelia knightii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
